channel.title: Nested for loop in Python
channel.description:
I'm trying to write a program in Python that prints this pattern: [code] ***** **** *** ** * [/code]
The code I have basically does the inverse and I can't figure out why..
This is my code:
[code] def pattern(): integer = requestInteger("Please enter a number")
for number in range(0, integer): for variable in range(integer, 0, -1): if variable - 1 > number: sys.stdout.write(' ') else: sys.stdout.write('*') sys.stdout.write('\n') [/code]
If someone could help me, that would be great, thank you.

item.title: Nested for loop in Python
item.dc:creator: @watch_n_lern watch n lern
item.description:
@watch_n_lern wrote:

I’m trying to write a program in Python that prints this pattern:

*****
 ****
  ***
   **
    *

The code I have basically does the inverse and I can’t figure out why…

This is my code:

def pattern():
  integer = requestInteger("Please enter a number")
  
  for number in range(0, integer):
    for variable in range(integer, 0, -1):
      if variable - 1 > number:
        sys.stdout.write(' ')
      else:
        sys.stdout.write('*')
    sys.stdout.write('\n')

If someone could help me, that would be great, thank you.
